pageTitle: Patent US4863438 - Low profile gastrostomy device - Google Patents
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations Although the invention has been shown and described with respect to a certain preferred embodiment, it is obvious that equivalent alterations and modifications will occur to others skilled in the art upon the reading and understanding of the specification. The present invention includes all such equivalent alterations and modifications, and is limited only by the scope of the claims. From the foregoing, it will be apparent that the device of the present invention is easily inserted and self-retaining, with the outer end of the device remaining substantially flush with the skin. Because of the device's low profile, the device is not noticeable beneath the clothes of a patient and is not painful to wear. Also, there is little risk of dislodgement of the device, and the device is easy to use. Furthermore, the material of the device is minimally irritating to the skin, and if irritation should start to occur due to other causes, the device can easily be rotated a part turn to cause the retention wings to engage another portion of the skin that was previously exposed. Moreover, the device can be inserted into other viscera of the body for other applications as well, including, for example, urinary bladder drainage, ileostomy, jejunostomy, and cystostomy.
